intro: Limnobium bogotense, commonly known as the Bogotá water lily, is a aquatic plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its broad, floating leaves that provide habitat for various aquatic organisms. The plant produces white, fragrant flowers that bloom at night, attracting pollinators such as moths. Its rhizomes grow in shallow waters, anchoring the plant in muddy substrates. Limnobium bogotense plays a vital role in maintaining water quality and supporting aquatic biodiversity.
